head.title: A Passage to India: Asphalt and Dust

hedline.hl1: A Passage to India: Asphalt and Dust

block.p: Re ''In Today's India, Status Comes With Four Wheels'' (''India Accelerating'' series, front page, Dec. 5):
Many people in the world want all the consumer goods, gadgets and big fast cars that we have in the United States. But rejecting some of our ways would be healthier.
Re ''In Today's India, Status Comes With Four Wheels'' (''India Accelerating'' series, front page, Dec. 5):
Many people in the world want all the consumer goods, gadgets and big fast cars that we have in the United States. But rejecting some of our ways would be healthier.

We have clogged our highways, polluted the air and contributed to global warming by driving our cars. Most of the time we drive alone, never thinking to share the ride or use public transportation. At age 16, many young people think a car is their birthright -- ''What! Take the school bus?''
About 40,000 Americans die each year on our roads. We could help developing nations by educating them -- and by changing our own ways.
If we make our planet unlivable, no amount of consumer goods or hot cars will make us happy.
Jeannette Ollodart Marx Towson, Md., Dec. 5, 2005
